loopinvariant.name: Loop invariants dialect
loopinvariant.description: A small sample dialect enforcing loop invariants.

fsm.name: Finite state machine dialect
fsm.description: A dialect for implementing finite state machines as modules.

fsm_example.name: FSM client code
fsm_example.description: Example using finite state machine dialect.

literalblock.name: Literal block dialect
literalblock.description: A dialect enforcing that while loops are written with literal blocks, and offering errors and suggestions when they are not.

literal_test.name: Test for literal block dialect
literal_test.description: Example code producing an error from the literal block dialect

ObjectAssociations.name: Object associations dialect
ObjectAssociations.description: A dialect for using object associations/relations in your program.

ObjectAssociations_example.name: OA client code
ObjectAssociations_example.description: Example using the object associations dialect.

StaticGrace.name: Static Grace dialect
StaticGrace.description: A dialect enforcing that static type annotations are always present.

dialect.name: Dialect dialect
dialect.description: A dialect to assist in writing other dialects and checkers.

dialect_example.name: Dialect client code
dialect_example.description: Example using the Dialect dialect to implement the StaticGrace dialect in a more concise way.

grapl.name: GrAPL dialect
grapl.description: A Grace rendition of parts of APL, showing the use of operator definitions and other language features.

grapl_example.name: GrAPL example
grapl_example.description: Example using simple APL programs with the GrAPL dialect.

simplegraphics_example.name: Simple graphics demo
simplegraphics_example.description: Example using the cross-platform simple graphics library.

turtle.name: Turtle graphics module
turtle.description: Library to draw a turtle on the screen and allow it to be moved around by code.

logo.name: Logo-like dialect
logo.description: A dialect providing procedural turtle graphics access.

logo_example.name: Logo-like client code
logo_example.description: Example using the Logo-like turtle graphics dialect to draw a picture.

pong.name: DOM Pong
pong.description: Pong implemented on top of the HTML document object model directly.

snake.name: DOM Snake
snake.description: Snake implemented on top of the HTML document object model directly.

sniffpong.name: Sniff-based pong
sniffpong.description: Example code in the Sniff dialect, implementing Pong.

structural.name: Structural typechecking dialect
structural.description: A typechecking dialect enforcing structural subtyping.

structural_example.name: Structural typing example
structural_example.description: Sample code for the structural checking dialect.

dbc.name: Design-by-contract dialect
dbc.description: A simple dialect including loop invariants and preconditions.
